pageProps.content:
Experience

Kigali, the capital of Rwanda is located within the centre of the country on the Ruganwa River. This buzzing city is famous for its friendly people & warm hospitality.
Most people visit Rwanda to go on a once-in-a-lifetime gorilla-trekking safari, & since Kigali enjoys a convenient location close to Volcanoes National Park, it offers guests the ideal pit stop before or after a gorilla-trekking adventure.
The city provides a choice of accommodation choices, from large hotels to smaller boutique-style bed & breakfasts.

Activities

Visitors to Kigali can visit a variety of city attractions, such as the Genocide Memorial & the Inema or Ivuka Art Centres & even go shopping at the buzzing Kimironko market (arguably one of the best things to do in Kigali).
Day trips to Volcanoes National Park, Lake Kivu & Akagera National Park are some of the nearby Kigali top attractions.

When to travel

Although Kigali is located within the heart of Rwanda, it has a temperate climate with a good amount of rainfall, thanks to its high elevation. Temperatures may vary slightly based on the seasonal months.
Year-round temperatures in Kigali range from daytime highs between 25C and 27C (77F to 81F), & evening lows of 14C to 16C (57F to 61F). April through June are the coolest months, while visitors who opt to travel between June, July, August & September are likely to experience warmer, drier weather in Kigali thus the best time to visit the city.
Like the rest of the cities in East Africa, Kigali also has two wet seasons: the long rains & short rains. The long rains extend from March through May, with some showers possible even in January & February. The months of October to November experience the short rains, with December generally having a bit of rain as well.
It does not rain continuously throughout the day during the wet seasons, & there are times in Kigali when the sun is out. The hilly areas of Kigali & the countryside have a cooler climate with slight variations compared to the flatter lower altitude regions.

subfolders.title: Kigali Marriott
subfolders.description: Kigali Marriott Hotel is located within downtown Kigali, close to the financial district & Kigali City Hall.  The hotel is the ideal base from which to explore the city, or overnight before or after a gorilla- & chimp-trekking safari.   With an onsite spa, restaurant, cocktail bar & outdoor pool, guests will be able to enjoy all these amenities without ever having to leave the hotel.

subfolders.title: Kigali Serena Hotel
subfolders.description: Kigali Serena Hotel is located along one of Kigali’s most charming boulevards & has become a popular attraction in the city. This luxuriously styled hotel combines traditional Rwandese art & culture with modern amenities.  The hotel is the ideal base from which to explore the city, or overnight before or after a gorilla- & chimp-trekking safari.

subfolders.title: The Retreat by Heaven
subfolders.description: The Retreat by Heaven is arguably Kigali’s best premier boutique hotel.  Located in the heart of the capital, The Retreat provides a tranquil sanctuary after a long-haul flight or an exhilarating gorilla trek. The hotel is a forerunner when it comes to lightening its environmental impact & is therefore powered by sunlight.
